data.text:
Directed by Ellen Fenster

April 17th – May 10th, 2020 – PRODUCTION POSTPONED UNTIL FALL, 2020

Winner! 1981 Tony® Award, Best Play

Winner! 1985 Academy Award, Best Film

In the court of the Austrian Emperor Joseph II, Antonio Salieri is the established composer. Enter the greatest musical genius of all time: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. Salieri has given himself to God so that he might realize his sole ambition, to be a great composer. Mozart is a foul-mouthed, graceless oaf who has that which is beyond Salieri’s envious grasp: Genius.

“A total iridescent triumph […] of complexity of thought, emotion and dramatic power.” – New York Post

Amadeus opens Friday, April 17th and runs through Sunday, May 10th at the Gremlin Theatre – 550 Vandalia Street, St. Paul, MN 55114.

Free parking is available in the huge lot on Wabash Avenue near the water tower. There is also a lot across the street on the north side of Wabash Avenue. Enter the Annex building via the double doors next to Lake Monster brewery.

Amadeus

ADMISSION:

Adults: $28

Seniors / Fringe button holders: $25

Under 30: Pay half your age to any performance!

PERFORMANCE DATES & TIMES:

Performances start at 7:30pm Wednesdays through Saturdays, and 3:00pm on Sundays. Seating begins 30 minutes prior to show time.

Click here to view the schedule

All seating is general admission.

TICKET INFO:

Tickets are available for purchase online, by phone and in person the evening of the show. Tickets can be purchased by clicking on the button below:

You can can also order tickets by phone by calling 1-888-71-TICKETS Monday-Friday: 8:00am – 8:00pm.

Methods of Payment

We accept Visa, MasterCard, American Express, and Discover online.
